page.title: 16ATTITUDES IN WOLSTON
page.content: Everybody in the survey{liked living {in Wolston}and were{satisfied with the {amenities.}Some would be happy to see part of Bluemels land sold for small industrial units hoping for more employment. People were satisfied with the shops but some would have liked a chemist or a bank: children wanted a sports shop. The older residents of Bennett Court would like wardened housing nearer to the centre of the Village. It is a{long way to walk}to the village hall and shops though some did have lunch at the nearby Wolston High School and were very pleased to be involved with the children. Some people are against more housing being built in case the village loses its {rural identity.}Traffic in the village is a problem as much of it exceeds the 30 miles an hour speed limit and parking is difficult in narrow roads.
